title: Famous Queens Recall
description: Can you recall the remarkable queens who shaped history?

questions.question: Which English queen reigned for over 63 years during the Victorian era?
questions.explanation: Queen Victoria reigned from 1837 to 1901, making her reign one of the longest in British history until surpassed by Elizabeth II.

questions.question: Which queen was the last pharaoh of ancient Egypt?
questions.explanation: Cleopatra VII was the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, ruling until her death in 30 BC.

questions.question: Which French queen was executed during the French Revolution?
questions.explanation: Marie Antoinette, wife of King Louis XVI, was executed by guillotine on October 16, 1793, during the French Revolution.

questions.question: Which English queen defeated the Spanish Armada in 1588?
questions.explanation: Queen Elizabeth I led England to victory against the Spanish Armada in 1588, one of the greatest naval battles in history.

questions.question: Which Scottish queen was imprisoned and eventually executed by Elizabeth I?
questions.explanation: Mary, Queen of Scots was held captive for 19 years before Elizabeth I ordered her execution in 1587.

questions.question: Which queen of the Iceni tribe led a revolt against Roman occupation of Britain?
questions.explanation: Queen Boudicca led a major uprising against the Roman Empire in AD 60-61, destroying several Roman settlements including Londinium.

questions.question: Which female pharaoh ruled Egypt and is known for her successful trade expedition to Punt?
questions.explanation: Hatshepsut was one of the most successful female pharaohs, known for her prosperous reign and the famous trading expedition to the Land of Punt.

questions.question: Which Russian empress modernized Russia and expanded its empire in the 18th century?
questions.explanation: Catherine the Great ruled Russia from 1762 to 1796, greatly expanding the Russian Empire and promoting the arts and education.

questions.question: Which Hawaiian queen was the last sovereign monarch of the Hawaiian Kingdom?
questions.explanation: Queen Liliuokalani was the last monarch of Hawaii, overthrown in 1893 by a group of American businessmen and sugar planters.

questions.question: Which queen of Castile sponsored Christopher Columbus's voyage to the Americas?
questions.explanation: Queen Isabella I of Castile, along with her husband Ferdinand II of Aragon, sponsored Columbus's 1492 voyage that led to the European discovery of the Americas.

questions.question: Which queen consort of Henry VIII was the mother of Elizabeth I?
questions.explanation: Anne Boleyn was Henry VIII's second wife and the mother of the future Queen Elizabeth I. She was executed in 1536.

questions.question: Which queen of Palmyra challenged Roman authority in the 3rd century AD?
questions.explanation: Queen Zenobia of Palmyra conquered much of the Roman East before being defeated by Emperor Aurelian in 272 AD.

questions.question: Which Danish-born queen became the longest-reigning British monarch?
questions.explanation: Queen Elizabeth II reigned from 1952 to 2022, surpassing Victoria's record. However, she was not Danish-born -- she was born in London. The question refers to her record-setting reign.

questions.question: Which queen of Sweden famously abdicated her throne in 1654 and converted to Catholicism?
questions.explanation: Queen Christina of Sweden abdicated in 1654, converted to Catholicism, and moved to Rome, where she became a patron of the arts.

questions.question: Which Austrian-born queen became known as 'The Great' and was Empress of Austria and Queen of Hungary?
questions.explanation: Maria Theresa ruled the Habsburg dominions from 1740 to 1780, implementing major reforms in education, medicine, and the military.
